body_html:
Dear facaiy,
thank you very much for your fast reply!
Actually, yesterday evening I noticed the same issue, so I set shuffle=False, and performed several tests.
Now all the runs yield the same result, so your idea is good and very helpful for my goal, thank you!
Actually, generally speaking, setting shuffle=False is just a way to get around the real problem, because the problem still exists: even if one sets all the random seeds fixed, the shuffling still produces different results.
I feel there should be an easy way to declare whether or not a DNN run should be based on a fixed seed so as to make it repeatable. This would be, I believe, a great improvement in the ease of use of TensorFlow, and I hope you good guys will work on it.
By now, thanks a lot for your cooperation!
Ivan
